AudioData.Text: After a long day of productive [bullshitting], Raymond finally came to his senses and realized it was already 7pm. Everybody was long gone. But he was so absorbed in the riveting intricacies of this quarter’s financial reports such as how much child labor the company would need to increase profits next trimester or the projected 50% cut on his salary to realize that it was time to go home. He got up from his desk, and walked out of his cubicle.

Raymond couldn’t believe how unconscientious his coworkers were. How dare they not stay beyond working hours? Their lack of professionalism astounded him. He thought to himself, “there has to be another worthy worker around here!”, and started to think he should maybe look around the building to find that other willful slave.
When Raymond entered the room, he was faced with two doors. As the one on the right led to the building’s exit, he chose to go through the one on the left.

Raymond thought some dutiful employees might be taking a small nap in the break room, and headed there. As he walked, he remembered that it had been redecorated 2 years ago and couldn’t wait to discover it, since he had not taken a break since.

“What joyful, productive sights!” Raymond thought as he entered the room. It had been repainted in white and a new table football game had been installed. What a huge investment in the wellbeing of the employees of Corporate McCorporate Inc. He looked at the immaculate linoleum floor with glee, and the 3 haphazardly placed chairs and coffee machine really made for a great set piece. There was however no one to witness this beauty with, and Raymond therefore decided to move on with his search and head towards the conference room, as he thought he might have missed a meeting.

As Raymond walked towards the heavenly conference room, he noticed something was amiss. A pebble found its way in the door to the Super Secret Room, which had left it open. Of course, as he was a good employee, Raymond’s first instinct was to close it immediately. His curiosity could DEFINITELY NOT get the better of him. MOST DEFINITELY NOT RIGHT???

Raymond glanced inside the dimly lit room. A bunch of servers, wall to wall, floor to ceiling, menacingly stacked. The cables ran entangled throughout the place, and the whole atmosphere made Raymond uncomfortable, as he thought the internet ran itself, apparently.  It however struck him as odd that this room was usually so well guarded. If it was just the company’s servers, why did it need a reinforced steel door?  Raymond finally noticed there was another door opposite him and went to open it.
Raymond was absolutely bewildered by what he was gazing upon. Beyond a glass wall, a man with a VR headset laid there unconscious. How dare he have fun on company time?
